item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Michael Vick's adviser, agent believe signing may come soon
item.description: Michael Vick's personal adviser and his agent believe his return to the NFL is now not a question if "if," but "when" -- and that "when" may come soon.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Carolina Panthers QB Jake Delhomme expects Steve Smith on field for opener
item.description: Carolina Panthers quarterback Jake Delhomme expects four-time Pro Bowl receiver Steve Smith to play in the regular-season opener.

item.dc:creator: Adam Rittenberg
item.title: Ohio State Buckeyes coach Jim Tressel says Tyler Moeller will not play this season
item.description: Ohio State junior linebacker Tyler Moeller will miss the 2009 season because of a head injury sustained on a family vacation, Buckeyes coach Jim Tressel said Tuesday.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Pau Gasol of Los Angeles Lakers has surgery after hurting left hand during practice with Spain
item.description: Lakers center Pau Gasol had surgery on his left index finger after an injury during practice with Spain's national team. He will be sidelined at least three weeks.

item.dc:creator: Bob Harig
item.title: Tiger Woods says he was not fined by PGA Tour for critical remarks about rules official
item.description: Tiger Woods did not back down Tuesday from his criticism of a rules official after the final round of Sunday's WGC-Bridgestone Invitational and said he was not fined for his comments by the PGA Tour.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Donte' Stallworth of Cleveland Browns allowed to train with coach during house arrest
item.description: Suspended Cleveland Browns wide receiver Donte' Stallworth will be allowed to train with a strength and conditioning coach while on house arrest.

item.dc:creator: ESPNChicago.com
item.title: Patrick Kane's lawyer said the Chicago Blackhawks star did not rob or assault cab driver
item.description: Patrick Kane's lawyer said the Chicago Blackhawks star did not rob or assault a cab driver, and that Kane's cousin was involved in the financial transaction.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Terrell Owens misses Buffalo Bills practice after sore toe complaint
item.description: Terrell Owens was not present for the Buffalo Bills' morning walkthrough two days after the receiver complained about a sore toe following the team's preseason opener.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Michael Schumacher ends Formula One comeback due to injuries from motorcycle crash
item.description: Michael Schumacher on Tuesday announced he has called off his much-anticipated Formula One comeback because of lingering injuries from a motorcycling crash earlier this year.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Eunice Kennedy Shriver dies at 88; founded Special Olympics
item.description: President John F. Kennedy's sister Eunice Kennedy Shriver, a champion for the rights of the mentally disabled and founder of the Special Olympics, has died. She was 88.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Tulowitzki hits for cycle as Rockies beat Cubs
item.description: Troy Tulowitzki hit for the cycle and had a career-high seven RBIs to help Colorado beat the Cubs 11-5 on Monday night.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: The Chicago White Sox acquire Alex Rios on waivers from Toronto Blue Jays
item.description: The Chicago White Sox acquire Alex Rios on waivers from Toronto Blue Jays.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Cabbie's attorney says Patrick Kane incident overblown
item.description: The attorney for a cab driver who says he was beaten up by Patrick Kane and his cousin over pocket change said the incident had been blown out of proportion.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Boston Celtics re-sign free-agent power forward Glen 'Big Baby' Davis
item.description: The Celtics are bringing back Glen "Big Baby" Davis, announcing Monday that they've re-signed the power forward to a new deal. It's reportedly for two years.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: PGA Tour to fine Tiger Woods for criticizing rules official
item.description: Tiger Woods will be fined by the PGA Tour for his public criticism of a rules official after winning the Bridgestone Invitational, a tour official said.
